column4: Would anyone be able to help me out with an Nvidia driver installation?
Thanks. I have tried to use the Hardware Drivers tool in the system->admin but that doesn't work...doesn't error, just doesn't work
I tried to manually download a .run file from nvidia which I am just about positive is the correct one for me, stopped gdm and attempted installation...it worked but after restart it errored
what kinds or errors? Does /var/log/Xorg.0.log show anything related?
the Xorg.0.log file is roughly 200 lines long and I have no idea what any of it means
the error was something along the lines of the header module couldn't be found (nvidia created it I think...during installation)
look for messsages prepended by (EE) talking about nvidia.
(EE) Failed to initialize GLX extension (Compatible NVIDIA X driver not found)
ok, so the driver was not able to install correctly...
When installing manually from *.run do you get errors similar to the last section of this question: https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nvidia-graphics-drivers-180/+question/59795
I got no errored during installation of the driver (except that it couldn't connect to the internet to download the header module...or something along those lines)
did it succed in compiling it by itself after that?
I have installed it about a year ago on an older version of ubuntu with no troubles
What does "lspci | grep VGA" give you?
00:05.0 VGA compatible controller: nVidia Corporation C51 [Geforce 6150 Go] (rev a2)
